snippet: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel gave the military four to six weeks to improve access to treatment, quality of care and patient safety at hospitals and clinics.
abstract: Sec of Defense Chuck Hagel gives military four to six weeks to improve access to treatment, quality of care and patient safety at its hospitals and clinics; Hagel's orders hew to findings of panel of military and civilian experts who conducted comprehensive review of system that serves 1.35 million active-duty service members as well as millions of family members and others.

byline.original: By SHARON LaFRANIERE and ANDREW W. LEHREN

lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel gave the military four to six weeks to improve access to treatment, quality of care and patient safety at hospitals and clinics.

headline.main: U.S. Military Hospitals Are Ordered to Improve Care, Access and Safety
headline.print_headline: U.S. Military Hospitals Are Ordered to Improve Care, Access and Safety

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
